articles.title: NDFSK enlarged meeting held
articles.content:
Kim  Jong Il highly praised 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Dorank Assifat Diasseny, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, issued a statement on June 17 on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of General Secretary Kim  Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.
   He noted in the statement that the great Kim  Jong Il is an outstanding thinker and theoretician who has comprehensively developed and enriched the Juche idea founded by the President Kim  Il Sung.
   Under his wise guidance the Korean people have turned out in the gigantic struggle to build a powerful nation, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Laotian ambassador gives reception
articles.content:
NDFSK enlarged meeting held
   Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A communique on an enlarged meeting of the presidium of the c.c., the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) was published on June 15, according to the  Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation.
   The communique said that the NDFSK central committee held an  enlarged meeting of its presidium in Seoul on June 15 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the President Kim  Il Sung's demise.   
   "On organizing functions for remembering the great leader comrade Kim  Il Sung on the 5th anniversary of his demise" was discussed and decided  upon at the meeting.
   The decision of the meeting said that days from June 15 to July 15 will be set as a period of remembering the president.
   The NDFSK central committee will hold a remembering meeting on July 8 and its organizations at all levels and groups of different circles will conduct multifarious events in keeping with actual conditions during the period.

articles.title: Foreign councilors visit Sinchon Museum
articles.content:
Laotian ambassador gives reception
   Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Khamkheng Sayakeo, Laotian ambassador to Korea, hosted a reception at his embassy on Friday to observe the 25th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Lao people's Democratic Republic.
   Invited to the reception were vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Tong Chun, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Choe Jong Hwan, who is also vice-chairman of the Korea-Laos Friendship Association, and officials concerned.   Speeches were exchanged there.

articles.title: KCNA on S. Korea's military brinkmanship
articles.content:
Foreign councilors visit Sinchon Museum
   Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The foreign economic and commercial councilors' corps in Korea visited the Sinchon Museum Friday on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
   The visitors went round data and remains displayed at the museum, which tell about the atrocities the U.S. aggressors committed in Sinchon during our temporary retreat in the Fatherland Liberation War. Then they went to tombs  of 5,605 patriots, 400 mothers and 102 children murdered by the U.S. imperialists.   
   After the visit, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy Chen Yufa, who is the doyen of the corps, said the U.S. imperialists' brutal atrocities in Sinchon have invited protests and denunciation not only of the Korean people but also the world's peaceloving people.  Trade councilor of the Russian embassy Sergei Leushikin hoped that the tragic death of Korean children and their parents would not be repeated again.

S. Korean unionists stage demonstration in Seoul
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- More than 2,700 unionists of the three wagon manufacturing companies under Hyun Dai Precision Ind. Co., Ltd., Dae Woo and Handgun Heavy Industries Ltd. Reportedly entered into a strike on June 23 in demand of the guarantee of employment and the succession of unions' collective bargaining. And they are staging demonstrations in Seoul almost every day.   
   Over 2,000 unionists of Ulsan and Changwon factories under the Hyun Dai Precision Ind. Co., Ltd. held a rally in Jongro district, Seoul, on Thursday morning, urging the authorities to immediately stop the suppression of the trade unions and the unilateral "restructuring".
Meanwhile, more than 700 unionists of Dae Woo and Handgun Heavy Industries Ltd. staged a demonstration in front of the head office of the foreign exchange bank, demanding a stop to forced layoff by creditor bank.

articles.content:
Greetings to Djibouti President
   Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim  Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the  Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Ismail Omar, President of the Republic of Djibouti, on the occasion of the 22nd anniversary of its independence.
   It wished the president and his people success in the work for the prosperity of the country.
